text: Jim Gardner. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gardner J (2024). wardboundaries: UK Ward Boundaries Mapping. R package version 0.0.0.9002, https://jimgar.github.io/wardboundaries/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {wardboundaries: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping},   author = {Jim Gardner},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9002},   url = {https://jimgar.github.io/wardboundaries/}, }

title: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping
text: wardboundaries R data package mapping UK ward boundaries. main objects package sf tibbles ward boundaries, obtained ONS Open Geography Portal. original variables observations retained geometry column type MULTIPOLYGON added LAD codes names added datasets required, believe prove useful use cases data ready joined measurements plotted e.g. ggplot2 leaflet.

title: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping
text: 20m resolution countries_dec2022_20m lad_dec2022_20m lad_may2023_20m lad_dec2023_20m wards_dec2022_20m wards_may2023_20m wards_dec2023_20m 200m resolution wards_dec2011 wards_dec2019 wards_dec2020 wards_dec2021 wards_dec2022 wards_may2023 wards_dec2023 500m resolution countries_dec2022 lad_dec2022 lad_may2023

title: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping
text: Accessing dataset can done two ways. namespace, without loading whole library loading whole library
code: wardboundaries::wards_dec2022 #> Simple feature collection with 8483 features and 12 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -8.649996 ymin: 49.88234 xmax: 1.763571 ymax: 60.86087 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 8,483 × 13 #>    WD22CD    WD22NM   WD22NMW LAD22CD LAD22NM  BNG_E  BNG_N  LONG   LAT OBJECTID #>    <chr>     <chr>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>    <int>  <int> <dbl> <dbl>    <int> #>  1 E05000650 Astley … " "     E08000… Bolton  370670 412906 -2.44  53.6        1 #>  2 E05000651 Bradshaw " "     E08000… Bolton  374590 413058 -2.39  53.6        2 #>  3 E05000652 Breight… " "     E08000… Bolton  374437 409641 -2.39  53.6        3 #>  4 E05000653 Bromley… " "     E08000… Bolton  372113 414150 -2.42  53.6        4 #>  5 E05000654 Crompton " "     E08000… Bolton  371741 410493 -2.43  53.6        5 #>  6 E05000655 Farnwor… " "     E08000… Bolton  373564 406162 -2.40  53.6        6 #>  7 E05000656 Great L… " "     E08000… Bolton  371959 408204 -2.42  53.6        7 #>  8 E05000657 Halliwe… " "     E08000… Bolton  370828 409676 -2.44  53.6        8 #>  9 E05000658 Harper … " "     E08000… Bolton  371512 406080 -2.43  53.6        9 #> 10 E05000659 Heaton … " "     E08000… Bolton  367961 409240 -2.49  53.6       10 #> # title: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping
text: Perhaps sort demographic data ward. Plotting choropleth ggplot2 nice straightforward  following plot isn’t exactly pretty, shows easy focus particular local authority add labels
code: # Make some random numbers that represent a demographic dataset demo_data <- tibble::tibble(   WD22CD = dplyr::pull(wardboundaries::wards_dec2022, WD22CD),   number_of_ducks = sample(     150:1500, nrow(wardboundaries::wards_dec2022),     replace = TRUE   ) )  demo_data #> # A tibble: 8,483 × 2 #>    WD22CD    number_of_ducks #>    <chr>               <int> #>  1 E05000650            1036 #>  2 E05000651            1110 #>  3 E05000652             621 #>  4 E05000653             876 #>  5 E05000654             891 #>  6 E05000655             527 #>  7 E05000656             892 #>  8 E05000657             192 #>  9 E05000658            1031 #> 10 E05000659             968 #> # ℹ 8,473 more rows # Join the datasets together ducks_per_ward <- dplyr::left_join(   wardboundaries::wards_dec2022,   demo_data,   by = dplyr::join_by(WD22CD) ) # Plot ducks_per_ward |>   ggplot2::ggplot() +   ggplot2::geom_sf(ggplot2::aes(fill = number_of_ducks), colour = NA) +   ggplot2::theme_void() # Plot ducks_per_ward |>   dplyr::filter(LAD22NM == "Vale of White Horse") |>   ggplot2::ggplot() +   ggplot2::geom_sf(     ggplot2::aes(fill = number_of_ducks),     colour = NA,     show.legend = FALSE   ) +   ggplot2::geom_sf_label(ggplot2::aes(label = number_of_ducks)) +   ggplot2::theme_void()

title: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping
text: following example mainly cribbed Leaflet R. couple format helpers much code, ’s possible create interactive version map
code:
# Format helpers pal <- leaflet::colorNumeric("Greens", domain = ducks_per_ward$number_of_ducks) thousands <- scales::label_comma() labels <- sprintf( "%s
%s", ducks_per_ward$WD22NM, thousands(ducks_per_ward$number_of_ducks) ) |> lapply(htmltools::HTML) # Leaflet map leaflet::leaflet() |> leaflet::addTiles() |> leaflet::addPolygons( data = ducks_per_ward, fillColor = ~ pal(number_of_ducks), weight = 0.1, opacity = 0.9, color = "white", dashArray = "3", fillOpacity = 0.9, highlightOptions = leaflet::highlightOptions( weight = 1, color = "yellow", dashArray = "", fillOpacity = 0.9, bringToFront = TRUE ), label = labels, labelOptions = leaflet::labelOptions( style = list("font-weight" = "normal", padding = "3px 8px"), textsize = "15px", direction = "auto" ) ) |> leaflet::addLegend( pal = pal, values = ducks_per_ward$number_of_ducks, opacity = 0.9, title = NULL, position = "topleft" )

title: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping
text: needs suited example maps wardboundaries works just fine. complex requirements recommend checking geographr. go far beyond simple local authority / ward scenario boundaries larger hierarchies, lookup tables, NHS point data, etc. dataset geographr slimmed essential variables, may stitch different datasets together. Another important note polygons highly simplified, whereas wardboundaries offers 20m resolution.

title: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping
text: couple weeks making package knew next nothing geospatial data get hold . still don’t, Trafford Council’s Data lab wrote helpful Medium post explains work ONS Open Geography Portal’s API get data practice. niche interest resource help understand create specific query needs read data straight R sf.

title: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping
text: Spatial Data Science (applications R) “introduces explains concepts underlying spatial data: points, lines, polygons, rasters, coverages, geometry attributes, data cubes, reference systems, well higher-level concepts including attributes relate geometries affects analysis” Geocomputation R “people want analyze, visualize model geographic data open source software”

title: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping
text: Developed Jim Gardner. Hex image cropped Invocation 6 Helvetica Blanc. Largely modelled inspired geographr. See LICENCE

title: UK Countries Boundaries December 2022 — countries_dec2022
text: file contains digital vector boundaries Countries United Kingdom December 2022. boundaries available : (BUC) Ultra generalised (500m) - clipped coastline (Mean High Water mark). Contains Ordnance Survey ONS Intellectual Property Rights.

title: UK Countries Boundaries December 2022 — countries_dec2022
text: Simple feature collection 4 features 10 fields. FID ID CTRY22CD 2022 Country Code CTRY22NM 2022 Country Name CTRY22NMW 2022 Country Name (Welsh) BNG_E Easting BNG_N Northing LONG Longitude LAT Latitude Shape__Area Surface area (square meters) Shape__Length Boundary length (meters) geometry Geometry type MULTIPOLYGON

what: wardboundaries: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping — wardboundaries-package
title: wardboundaries: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping — wardboundaries-package
text: Contains datasets UK ward boundaries ONS Open Geography Portal. Datasets pre-formatted sf objects geom column type MULTIPOLYGON.

title: wardboundaries: UK Ward Boundaries for Mapping — wardboundaries-package
text: Maintainer: Jim Gardner jimmahgee@gmail.com

what: Ward Boundaries for England and Wales December 2011 — wards_dec2011
title: Ward Boundaries for England and Wales December 2011 — wards_dec2011
text: Boundaries Wards England Wales, December 2011. BGC boundaries generalised (20m) - clipped coastline (Mean High Water mark), however polygons simplified reduce file size less line 200m datasets (20m available version). LAD codes names added using ONS Dec 2011 lookup. Contains Ordnance Survey ONS Intellectual Property Rights.

title: Ward Boundaries for England and Wales December 2011 — wards_dec2011
Ward Boundaries for England and Wales December 2011 — wards_dec2011
text: Simple feature collection 8588 features 9 fields. OBJECTID Equivalent row number WD11CD 2011 Ward Code WD11CDO 2011 alternative Ward Code WD11NM 2011 Ward Name (English) WD11NMW 2011 Ward Name (Welsh) Shape__Area Surface area (square meters) Shape__Length Boundary length (meters) LAD11CD 2011 Local Authority District Code LAD11NM 2011 Local Authority District Name geometry Geometry type MULTIPOLYGON

title: wardboundaries 0.0.0.9002
text: Wards LAD December 2023
